headline: Oil Prices Are Rising. What’s Lifting Crude After Its Two-Day Slump.
summary: Oil prices are rising after two days of falls.  A bigger than-expected drawdown in U.S. crude inventories has amplified new developments in Venezuela.  Brent crude  has climbed 1.75% to $60.65 a barrel, while  U.S. West Texas Intermediate  crude was at $56.95 a barrel, up 1.73%.

headline: Is Exxon Mobil (XOM) Offering Value After Recent Share Price Moves Around US$118
summary: Wondering if Exxon Mobil at around US$118 a share is offering fair value or an opportunity? This article walks through what the current price might be telling you. The stock has seen a 1.5% decline over the last 7 days, a 2.2% gain over the last 30 days, and is up 14.9% over 1 year. Its year-to-date return stands at a 3.4% decline and its 3-year return is 18.0%, with a very large 5-year return. Recently, Exxon Mobil has stayed in focus as one of the major integrated energy companies...
